page.title: 12LOCHGOILHEAD-FARMING(1)
page.content: Pole Farm is run by Jim Jackson and his son Davy.They have{3200 Scottish {Blackface Sheep}on{3240 hectares}of mainly hill ground.They breed Blackface sheep because they are hardy and require little concentrate feed. They are most suitable for this type of environment. Of the lambs born about 20% are twins.650 lambs are kept for breeding stock and the rest are sold.They keep the ewes for 5 years and then sell them because they are too old for hill ground.The average price for one is about Â£35.Another source of income is wool for which they receive approx. 90p./kg. Some carse land is used to grow crops which are used mainly for feeding the sheep.(e.g.rape,cabbage,hay).They buy in feeding such as{beet pulp,bruised {barley,hay and turnips.}They keep a jersey cow for milk and hens for eggs.
